Andy Coulson , the former editor of the News of the World, stood down after a series of new revelations about illegal phone-hacking during his time at the tabloid. The Prime Minister's spokesman said: He had finished what he wanted to finish and good progress is being made with his replacement.`` It was his choice to leave quietly but he said a proper goodbye to the prime minister and those he worked closely with. Andy Coulson resigned as editor of the News of the World in 2007 when its royal editor, Clive Goodman , was jailed for conspiracy to access phone messages. of Evansville political science professor. If Mike Pence is to encounter any bumps at all, they could come early, as he shifts his focus from federal to state issues, Robert Dion said. In some cases, it can be an awkward transition, to go from being a lawmaker to an executive, and to go from the federal level to the state level. There's going to be that transition that might have a few hiccups to it, he said.`` But he's familiar with all the issues, he's an energetic campaigner, he's got solid conservative credentials, he knows how to raise money.''
